definition: article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: A careful examination of the painting could tell whether it is an original or a copy.
sentences.chinese: 仔细研究一下这幅画，就能看出它是赝品还是真迹。

sentences.english: The products on sale are fakes.
sentences.chinese: 市道市情上卖的那些外壳都是赝品。

sentences.english: You can tell that watch is a fake because the words carved on the back are misspelled.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看出这表是赝品，由于刻在背面的字拼错了。

sentences.english: An expert was needed to authenticate the original van gogh painting from his imitation.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是梵谷的真迹还是赝品，需由专家来鉴定。

sentences.english: Here are seven of the most famous photoshop fakes.
sentences.chinese: 下面是七个最著名的PS赝品。

sentences.english: Adiscerning connoisseur would have found the vase a fake .
sentences.chinese: 一个识货的鉴赏家本会发现这个古瓶是赝品。

sentences.english: But then this is the age of fakes.
sentences.chinese: 但是这注定了是一个赝品流行的时代。

sentences.english: I created it merely as a refrence in substitution for the real Gate.
sentences.chinese: 我仅仅是建造一个赝品来代替真正旳大门。

sentences.english: On closer examination the painting was proved to be a fake.
sentences.chinese: 再经仔细观察证实那幅画是赝品。

definition: authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
the strokes of a character/calligraphy and painting
to copy/to produce sth after a model/to counterfeit
